title: Mirror Circuits
description: The Mirror Circuits benchmark schema definition, describing parameters for mirror circuit benchmarking of quantum computers.

benchmark_name.description: Name of the benchmark. Must be 'Mirror Circuits' for this schema.

width.description: Number of qubits to use for the mirror circuit. If not specified, uses all available qubits on the device.

num_layers.description: The number of random Clifford layers in the mirror circuit. This controls the circuit depth.

two_qubit_gate_prob.description: Probability of applying a two-qubit gate on available edges. Must be between 0 and 1.

two_qubit_gate_name.description: Type of two-qubit gate to use in the circuit.

num_shots.description: Number of measurement shots (repetitions) for the benchmark.

num_circuits.description: Number of random circuit repetitions for statistical averaging. Multiple circuits provide more robust statistical results.

seed.description: Optional random seed for reproducible circuit generation. If provided, circuits will be deterministic.
